intro: Ornithogalum fimbriatum, commonly known as the fringed star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its strap-shaped, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers in spring, which are often tinged with green at the base. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ornithogalum fimbriatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
